content.rendered:
The team at Stratasys Direct Manufacturing introduced SMS Research Advisors and did a large independent study that was sent out to 40,000 designers, engineers and executives. In all, 700 people completed this survey and 40 percent said they work at companies who take in more than $50 million in revenue. That is important because these results are driven by leaders at successful companies that will be leading the industry.

The report set out to answer the following questions:

  1. How will companies use 3D printing over the next 3 years?  
  2. What do they see as the obstacles 3D printing adoption?  
  3. What is the business value?  
  4. How will product development evolve?  
  5. Who will invest in owning the technology?  
  6. What role will the service provider play?  

The survey showed that engineers see 3D printing as a tool to fabricate objects that have extreme design complexities. That is fascinating because it bucks the trend that 3D printing is fun and of use only when you want to produce a trinket instead of a complex item that fits into your manufacturing process.

The same research shows however that equipment cost concerns remain.

Leaping the hurdle

For companies looking to capitalize on 3D printings capabilities while controlling their costs, Print a Thing’s network can help them print their parts and designs without investing millions in equipment and training. Simply design your part and place your order, it’s easy and leaves you time for the things you’d rather be doing – like surveys.

To find how Print a Thing can print your designs go to https://printathing.com

To get a full copy of the report pages.stratasysdirect.com/trend-forecast.
